That's a great idea! Facebook is a fantastic platform to engage with your audience, and even though you may not have as many followers as you do on Instagram, it's still an important platform to consider.

Here's a sample post to get you started:

**Facebook Post:**

"Hey everyone! I'm excited to announce that I'm working on a new video series all about watercolor techniques! I want to make sure I'm creating content that resonates with you, so I'd love to hear your feedback. Which watercolor techniques would you like to see covered in my series? Wet-on-wet, glazing, or something else? Let me know in the comments!

And as a reminder, if you haven't already, be sure to check out my YouTube channel [Your Channel Name]! My watercolor painting tutorial has already gotten 2,500 views, and I'm excited to create more content for you.

Thanks for your feedback, and I look forward to hearing your suggestions!"

**Why this post works:**

1. **Clear ask**: You're directly asking your audience for feedback, making it easy for them to respond.
2. **Concise and to the point**: Your post is short and to the point, making it easy to read and understand.
3. **Mentioning your YouTube channel**: You're promoting your YouTube channel and highlighting the success of your watercolor painting tutorial, which can help drive traffic and attract new subscribers.
4. **Call-to-action**: You're encouraging your audience to take action by leaving a comment with their feedback.

By sharing a post on your Facebook page, you'll be able to engage with your audience, gather feedback, and promote your YouTube channel and video series. Remember to keep your post concise, visually appealing, and engaging, and don't forget to respond to any comments or messages you receive!
